section.title: Provisioning &slsa; Yourself
section.para: This section outlines the steps needed to manually provision a &slsa; node so that it can be added to a new or existing &kw-hos-phrase; cloud.

step.para: Take note of the IP address of the &clm; node. It will be used below during .
Mount or copy the contents of SLE-12-SP3-Server-DVD-x86_64-GM-DVD1.iso to /srv/www/suse-12.3/x86_64/repos/ardana/sles12/zypper/OS/

note.para: If you choose to mount an ISO, we recommend creating an /etc/fstab entry to ensure the ISO is mounted after a reboot.

step.para: Boot the &cloudos; ISO.
Agree to the license

Edit the network settings, enter the the management network IP address recorded earlier. It is not necessary to enter a Hostname/. For product registration to work correctly, you must provide a DNS server. Enter the Name Server IP address and the Default IPv4 Gateway.
Additional System Probing will occur.
On the Registration page, you can skip registration if the database server does not have a external interface or if there is no SMT server on the MGMT LAN.
No Add On Products are needed.
For System Role, select Default System. Do not select KVM Virtualization Host.
Partitioning
Select Expert Partitioner and Rescan Devices to clear Proposed Settings.
Delete all Volume Groups.
Under the root of the directory tree, delete /dev/sda.
Delete any other partitions on any other drives.
Add Partition under sda, called ardana, with a Custom Size of 250MB.
Add an EFI Boot Partition. Partition should be formatted as FAT and mounted at /boot/efi.
Add Partition with all the remaining space (Maximum Size). The role for this partition is Raw Volume (unformatted). It should not be mounted. It should not be formatted.
Select Volume Management and add a volume group to /dev/sda2 called ardana-vg.
Add an LV to ardana-vg called root, Type of Normal Volume, Custom Size of 50GB, Raw Volume (unformatted). Format as Ext4 File System and mount at /.
Acknowledge the warning about having no swap partition.
Press Next on the Suggested Partitioning page.
Pick your Time Zone and check Hardware Clock Set to UTC.
Create a user named ardana and a password for system administrator. Do not check Automatic Login.
On the Installation Settings page:

listitem.para: Set text as the Default systemd target.

step.para: Press Install and Confirm Installation with the Install button.
Installation will begin and the system will reboot automatically when installation is complete.
When the system is booted, log in as root, using the system administrator set during installation.
Set up the ardana user and add ardana to the sudoers group.
Enter and retype the password for user ardana.
Add an ardana group (id 1000) and change group owner to ardana.
Disconnect the installation ISO. List repositories and remove the repository that was used for the installation.
Identify the Name of the repository to remove.
Copy the SSH key from the &clm;.
Log in to the &slsa; via SSH.
Continue with the site.yml playbook to scale out the node.
Use the ip addr command to find out what network devices are on your system:

step.para: Identify the one that matches the MAC address of your server and edit the corresponding config file in /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts.
Edit the IPADDR and NETMASK values to match your environment. Note that the IPADDR is used in the corresponding stanza in servers.yml. You may also need to set BOOTPROTO to none.

section.title: Set up passwordless SSH access
section.para: Once you have started your installation using the &clm;, or if you are adding a &slsa; node to an existing cloud, you need to copy the &clm; public key to the &slsa; node. One way of doing this is to copy the /home/ardana/.ssh/authorized_keys from another node in the cloud to the same location on the &slsa; node. If you are installing a new cloud, this file will be available on the nodes after running the bm-reimage.yml playbook.

important.para: Ensure that there is global read access to the file /home/ardana/.ssh/authorized_keys.
